member.name: T:C1.WPF.TabControl.C1TabControl
member.summary: Represents a control that contains multiple items that share the same space on the screen.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines whether the tab strip is shown when the control has only one child.

member.summary: Gets or sets the DataTemplate to apply to any TabItem that does not have a ContentTemplate property defined.

member.name: F:C1.WPF.TabControl.C1TabControl._unselectedContentMode
member.summary: Gets or sets what is done with the content of unselected items.
member.remarks: The default is Default, which removes from the visual tree the content of unselected items. Changing the property to retain the content of unselected items improves performance at the cost of memory.

member.name: T:C1.WPF.TabControl.UnselectedContentMode
member.summary: Determines how retains the content of s never or no longer selected.

member.name: F:C1.WPF.TabControl.UnselectedContentMode.Default
member.summary: Specifies the default behavior.
member.remarks: If the C1TabControl.UnselectedContentMode property is set to Default, the behavior is the same as with OutsideVisualTree setting. If the C1TabItem.UnselectedContentMode property is set to Default, the actual TabItem behavior will be inherited from the parent C1TabControl.

member.name: F:C1.WPF.TabControl.UnselectedContentMode.OutsideVisualTree
member.summary: The visual tree only contains the content of the selected item. The content of unselected items is not in the visual tree.

member.name: F:C1.WPF.TabControl.UnselectedContentMode.Collapsed
member.summary: The content of an item is grafted into the visual tree when first selected. When an item is unselected, the content is kept in visual tree with collapsed visibility.

member.name: P:C1.WPF.TabControl.C1TabItem.UnselectedContentMode
member.summary: Gets or sets what is done with the content of unselected items.
member.remarks: The default is Default, which removes from the visual tree the content of unselected items. Changing the property to retain the content of unselected items improves performance at the cost of memory.

member.name: M:C1.WPF.TabControl.Ranking.OnAdded(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Silverlight first inserts all n elements in ItemsControl.Items and then calls OnItemsChanged n times with Action=Add. This is a problem because rankFromIndex may return -1 for existing items. So we add all items on the first add and then ignore the following.
